name: Land Technologies
description: LandInsight is a new platform that is fundamentally changing how the property industry buys land for development. It’s a big data platform that speeds up the process of finding, assessing and buying land. It comes at an important time, one of the biggest challenges for the UK housing crisis is tackling the shortage of development land.

team.name: Jonny Britton
team.bioHtml: Co-founder @Land Technologies • Worked at @TimeMaps • Studied at @University of Manchester

team.title: Business Development
team.name: Neil Druian
team.bioHtml: Experienced sales leader in B2B SaaS markets with a record of driving sales growth and building outperforming teams at both a startup and large corporations.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.description:
“So, how can a tech company help solve the housing crisis?” If that’s the sort of question that intrigues you, this might just be the opportunity you’ve been searching for.

About the Company

LandTech is helping the industry build the homes we desperately need by cutting out the inefficiencies in the development process. Our flagship product, Landinsight, helps property developers understand the development potential of any plot of land within seconds. Our tech has changed the game and as a result we’ve become the UK’s fastest growing PropTech company (it’s official, we’ve got the awards to prove it!).

In the last 12 months alone, we have grown from 12 employees to 48. Our user base is doubling regularly and already, tens of thousands of homes have been built on sites that were sourced using Landinsight and that’s just the beginning.

The next few years are going to be huuuuuge as we start building out the rest of our vision to enable everyone to take the next step on their property development journey. This vision is backed by the same investors behind Love Film, TransferWise, Zoopla, Shazaam and Property Partner.

Real issues, real tech, underpinned by a real economic opportunity. That’s LandTech.

Our Values and Culture

We truly believe that businesses flourish when people work collaboratively. That’s why we prioritise team building and facilitation. You’ll also be in constant contact with the company founders, so you can learn about the conception of and running of a startup company that is scaling up. We run weekly sessions to ensure every voice is heard and empowered to grow and contribute.

We don’t just make empty gestures about our culture - we were voted as the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work at, and have also received awards for ‘Diversity Advocate’ and ‘Best at Employee Development’.

Our company values are ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’ and we regularly hold ourselves accountable to these. The people who work here feel that are challenged, but also feel like they have the environment and tools to succeed. Glassdoor backs this up.

Your Mission

Our Customer Success Team is a crucial area of our business and a vital component to our growth plans.

Not to be confused with Customer Support, a Customer Success Manager is responsible for building and maintaining lasting relationships with clients by providing clear strategic success plans to our enterprise accounts alongside expert training, guidance, and advice to ensure that Landinsight becomes the must-have tool within their business, helping them grow and achieve their objectives and return on investment.

It’s a fantastic role that is both challenging yet rewarding and will allow you to develop and grow and have a real influence in the direction of our team.

With no sales driven targets, your main focus, infact, your ONLY focus, is making your customers successful.

Experience isn’t necessary, we can help you with that but what you do need is a proactive, confident, professional approach with a real passion for helping our customers achieve success.

You need to be enthusiastic about what you do and be a real people person, able to deal with different types of people at all levels and confident delivering training and presentations to large audiences.

You have to be organised, diligent and creative in your approach engaging your clients and continuing to add on going value and support.

Culture is important, it’s a huge part of who we are. So we are looking for people with the same beliefs. What’s our values?! Open, Empower, Home!

We would love to hear from you if you are ready for a team that is warm, engaged and collaborative. 

About our offering

Flexible working hours (as long as you’re in for 11am) and place (work from home, a cafe, whatever suits you best)
Comprehensive onboarding and training
Professional and personal empowerment budget
Load of social events
Gym and wellness contributions, and cycle to work scheme
Work at WeWork’s flagship office, 2 mins from Liverpool St station
Work across departments and teams, including the CEO and CTO
Quarterly company wide strategy day - followed by team social!
Annual ski/ snowboard trip
Dedication to only hiring for a cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a beer/ glass of prosecco with at the free bar we have available after 2pm each day
Competitive Salary and Equity Options
25 days paid holiday (additional to bank holidays)
Unlimited unpaid holidays

Work across departments and teams, including the CEO and CTO

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a passionate, empathetic, self-starting Data Engineer to improve and scale our data processing as we scale our company.

About the Company

Want to take on a challenging problem? How about one of the UK’s most challenging problems? The Housing Crisis is an issue which has an effect on all of us. We’re helping to make a systemic change in the  property industry, using our software to make the sector more dynamic, transparent, and efficient. 

Taking on this problem creates a host of issues for us to address: 
* Maintaining data sets from over 600 sources
* Interpreting unstructured data
* Displaying all this information intuitively
* Most importantly building something that will get more homes built!

These are but a few of the challenges we face and it’s these that keep us all excited to turn up to work.

You’ll be surrounded by driven, passionate, brilliant people. You’ll also be surrounded by people who end up being your mates. We love spending time together outside work - we do everything from our annual company Ski Trip, to paintball, escape-rooms, cooking classes, and your humble Thursday or Friday beers (thanks, WeWork). We’re a company which, well, enjoys each other’s company!

Join us and join something greater than yourself. Join a mission which is going to impact the country. Join a team of people who will help you learn and grow. 

The Role

We’re scaling our our company and that includes scaling our data. We’re consuming data from over 600 different sources and we need to maintain accuracy, reliability, and visibility of our coverage. And that’s not even mentioning all the customer data we’re collecting. That’s where you come in. As our Data Engineer, you’ll be in charge of taking our current data pipelines and improving them so they’re efficient, reliable, and scalable. You will have the opportunity to take your existing knowledge of data processing techniques and apply them to our stack, as well as experimenting with and implementing emerging technologies.

We value an open and collaborative working environment, so you can be sure your voice will be heard. Each of our engineers contributes to the decisions we make as a team, both in tech, but also the wider company. A more collaborative and diverse environment leads to better outcomes, but we also end up learning a lot from our fellow colleagues.

Moving fast is a priority for us. We value fast-feedback and data-driven decision making. This applies to our data as well. You will be encouraged to make mistakes, learn quickly, and iterate on your solutions. We love knowing what we’re doing is adding value and seeing the impact of our solutions, and you will too.

You should apply if
* You have experience developing production-grade software using common 
  languages and tools (Javascript, Python, Jest, AWS, Docker)
* You’re excited by the prospect of redefining how an industry works
* You’re keen to take ownership of different areas of the software stack
* You love to experiment with new tech and try out new ideas
* You’re able to communicate with other engineers and also non-technical
* You can empathise with users and colleagues to understand the problems 
  they face
* You love moving, iterating, testing, and deploying quickly
* You’re excited by the challenge we’re taking on / by the opportunity to solve 
  one of the UK’s biggest challenges

About our offering:

* Flexible working hours (as long as you’re in for 11am) and location (work 
  from home, a cafe, whatever suits you best)
* Professional and personal empowerment budget
* Loads of social events 
* Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
* Work at WeWork’s flagship office, 2 mins from Liverpool St station
* Work closely with other departments and teams, including the Founders
* Quarterly company wide social day (think paintballing, cooking classes, 
  escape rooms, etc.)
* Annual ski / snowboard trip
* 33 days flexi holiday (including bank holidays) and buy as much extra holiday 
  as you want
* Competitive salary and equity options

If you think you would be a great fit for LandInsight please apply with your CV and a covering letter explaining why you’re right for the role.

jobs.title: Product Marketer
jobs.description:
Who we are

We’re LandTech – the award-winning technology startup revolutionising the property industry.

We started with LandInsight, which made it easier to find and assess off-market land. But we’ve grown a lot since then.

In fact, we’re the fastest-growing PropTech company in the UK. And PropTech just happens to be one of the fastest-growing sectors in the UK too.

With the level of confidence the co-founders put into each hire, and the support they offer along the way, you get the opportunity to learn fast, skill up, and develop an incredible career.


About the role

As LandTech’s first product marketer your mission is to help those interested in LandTech understand how we can help them reach the results they seek. You will empower the entire company to rally behind the same messaging by providing battle cards and enablement materials that allow them to better communicate with prospects and users.

By working with the rest of the Marketing team you will also ensure our current users get the most out of their subscriptions by creating educational content about product best practice, as well as deliver the content to them using a range of marketing channels.

Ultimately, your goal is to supercharge LandTech’s growth by bringing new users to our platform and making sure they see the benefits of staying with us for many years to come.

Key responsibilities

* Coordinate Product Launches – Work with the Product department and the Marketing teams to determine the positioning of products and features, identify the channels to communicate launches on, and create the content needed for all channels, whether the target is a current or potential user.
* Lead the creation of Product Content – Identify what product content we need across the customer lifecycle and take ownership of the creation and execution to ensure customers are receiving the right message at the right time.
* Drive Product Adoption - Create strategies for amplifying our product content through our marketing channels and automation to drive key product usage across the customer lifecycle. Regularly review the effectiveness of said strategies to drive the right behaviour and leverage a/b testing to continuously improve their impact.

Our culture

Everything we do is underpinned by our three core values: Open, Empower, Home.

We believe that businesses (and people) do their best work when they’re working collaboratively. That means you’ll be working directly with everyone in the business, right up to the co-founders Jonny and Andrew.

Read more about who we are, and how we work, here (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fland.tech%2Fabout%2F) .

It’s this attitude that saw us voted the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work for, and receive awards for ‘Best at Employee Development’.

We want the best people. And we offer some great perks to get (and keep) them.

Requirements

* Past Product Marketing Success – You don't need to have years of Product Marketing experience but you can prove past success in leading product marketing activities and campaigns.
* Communication Expertise – You are a master at converting technical products and features into end user benefits. Contextualisation of the communication to a specific target audience and communication format (presentation, video, help article etc) is something you have done before.
* Project Coordination Experience - You are used to bringing together input from several stakeholders and successfully coordinate projects to deliver on the desired business result.


Great-to-haves

* Past Video Creation Experience - The best way to teach someone about a product and how to use it is via video, and even though we have a creative team it is highly beneficial for you to be able to create product demo/help videos on your own to drive product awareness/engagement.
* Knowledge of Hubspot, Drift, Appcues or similar – Automation is your bread and butter. These are the core tools we're currently using to automate product related marketing and knowledge of them will help you be more independent and able to execute on product marketing activites end-to-end. We're open to others if you have suggestions, but these will be your starting point.

Benefits


* Competitive salary and equity options
* Flexible working hours
* 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays)
* Unlimited unpaid holiday
* Professional and personal training budget
* Gift vouchers for buying your first home, tying the knot and having a baby
* Gym and wellness contributions
* Cycle-to-work scheme
* Dog-friendly office
* An inclusive community – sharing time in an annual ski trip, all-company quarterly away days, and monthly socials
* Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who is decent, passionate about what they do, and eager to learn and grow

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer (Data & DevOps)
jobs.description:
We’re LandTech. We’re the award-winning tech startup building platforms to bring much-needed innovation to the property industry. We started with LandInsight, which made it easier to find and assess off-market land. Then we launched LandEnhance, bringing tech to the planning sector. And we’ve got plenty more in the pipeline.

We’re the fastest-growing PropTech company in the UK. And PropTech just happens to be one of the fastest-growing sectors in the UK too.

Imagine what that could do for your career progression.

Your Mission

At the heart of our product is open data, which we pull in from a wide range of sources. Our customers expect the data to be up to date, accurate, and intelligently integrated into our platform.

The datasets typically contain 1-30 million items. In some cases this is nice and clean at the point we receive it, but in other cases we have to use a combination of machine-learning and hand-crafted algorithms to extract metadata from plain text or pdfs. Also, since most of our data is geospatial, we focus a lot on geocoding data accurately and joining across geospatial datasets.

In this role, you will first need to assess the infrastructure we currently have, as built by our full-stack engineers. You will then plan how to migrate towards a more robust system, this includes building tools and processes that will empower our remote contractors to keep a check on, and maintain, parts of the system (e.g. scrapers). Importantly, the new system will need to be flexible as we add new datasets and squeeze more meaning from existing datasets.

A second aspect of the role will be working with geospatial data generated by our users. This part of the business is more in its infancy, but we have grand ambitions for it and would want you to aid in the decision making, even if not working on the implementation yourself.

Our Tech and Principles

* Node.js (Vue.js & React), Python, Shell Scripts
* Data stores such as Mongo, Postgres and ElasticSearch
* CI and some CD via CircleCI
* AWS (EB, ECS, Beanstalk, S3) and Kubernetes Cluster (ELK stack, Grafana+Prometheus, Istio)
* A mixture of Lean, DevOps and Agile principles
* Collaborative, test-first, fast-feedback software principles
* A focus on *nix tooling and open source software

Responsibilities

* Developing (improving existing and/or creating new) interfaces and/or pipelines to facilitate data collection.
* Identifying, debugging and fixing issues. This includes liaising with other technical/non-technical staff.
* Working closely with remote colleagues (technical and non-technical) who also work on data projects
* Improving our algorithms that derive data from the incoming datasets.
* Educating our full-stack engineers to be better data engineers.

Requirements

Essential criteria

* You are highly competent in one or more programming languages (5+ years experience)
* You are able to reason about the behaviour of systems before starting to build them
* You have built a variety of data processing/management systems
* You have experience with various data visualisation and business intelligence systems
* You are a clear communicator in both written and verbal forms.

Desirable criteria

* AWS
* NodeJS (or simply JavaScript)
* MongoDB
* Postgres
* Elasticsearch
* Geographical Information Systems
* ScrapingHub

Benefits

Our company was built on three core values: ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’

We believe that businesses (and people) do their best work when they’re working collaboratively. That means you’ll be working directly with everyone in the business, right up to the co-founders Jonny and Andrew.

It’s this attitude that saw us voted the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work for, and receive awards for ‘Best at Employee Development’.

And, of course, we offer some great perks the best people...

* Competitive salary and equity options
* Flexible working hours
* 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays)
* Unlimited unpaid holidays
* Professional and personal training budget
* Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
* Dog-friendly office
* Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
* Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a drink with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

Essential criteria

  • You are highly competent in one or more programming languages (5+ years experience)
  • You are able to reason about the behaviour of systems before starting to build them
  • You have built a variety of data processing/management systems
  • You have experience with various data visualisation and business intelligence systems
  • You are a clear communicator in both written and verbal forms.

Desirable criteria

  • AWS
  • NodeJS (or simply JavaScript)
  • MongoDB
  • Postgres
  • Elasticsearch
  • Geographical Information Systems
  • ScrapingHub

Benefits

Our company was built on three core values: ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’

We believe that businesses (and people) do their best work when they’re working collaboratively. That means you’ll be working directly with everyone in the business, right up to the co-founders Jonny and Andrew.

It’s this attitude that saw us voted the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work for, and receive awards for ‘Best at Employee Development’.

And, of course, we offer some great perks the best people...

  • Competitive salary and equity options
  • Flexible working hours
  • 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays)
  • Unlimited unpaid holidays
  • Professional and personal training budget
  • Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
  • Dog-friendly office
  • Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
  • Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a drink with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
We’re looking for Business Development Managers working within SaaS sales, do you want to work with a product that has barely any competition, in a market that is crying out for it? Along with an uncapped commission structure (and a bunch of other benefits of course!)...then read on.

We’re LandTech. We’re the award-winning tech startup building platforms to bring much-needed innovation to the property industry.

We started with LandInsight, which made it easier to find and assess off-market land. Then we launched LandEnhance, bringing tech to the planning sector. And we’ve got plenty more in the pipeline.

We’re the fastest-growing PropTech company in the UK. And PropTech just happens to be one of the fastest-growing sectors in the UK too.

Imagine what that could do for your career progression.

Your Mission

Your mission is to grow our customer base and revenue which ultimately contributes to the continued growth of the business! We’ve gone from 30 people in the beginning of 2019 to over 70 in 2020 and we’re not slowing down.

LandTech uses cutting-edge technology to try and solve the problems plaguing the property industry. We’re not just doing it to help the industry – we want to help get more houses built, faster, by a more diverse range of people. A big goal? Sure. But it’s backed by the same investors behind TransferWise, Zoopla, Shazaam and Property Partner.

We believe in a pretty flat hierarchy – you’ll have direct access to everyone, from the two co-founders down. And you’ll have direct input into how the company runs, and how we can scale fast. Targets change all the time, and we want help from other bright people that can build on the firm foundations we’ve put in place.

Responsibilities

* Generating new leads through a combination of best-in-class lead gen tools like Linkedin Sales Navigator, your own network and active prospecting
* Establishing yourself as a product expert, you will be booking in and leading slick product demonstrations whilst answering any questions our future customers have
* Representing LandTech professionally, you will handle the pricing, negotiation and closing on behalf of the business
* Measuring and reporting on sales metrics and performance, you’ll recognise if something isn’t working or could be better you’ll take the initiative to improve it
* Reporting to the Sales Manager (weekly/monthly/quarterly) regarding sales results and share any insights/success stories with the rest of the team
* Liaising with the Customer Success team to ensure efficient on-boarding with new clients, giving them a great experience from day 1
* Oversee activities, monitor performance and deliver continual training for the SDRs within the sales department
* Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing/payment plans
* Creating strategies to optimise performance and keep getting better results

Requirements

* Solid B2B experience selling a SaaS product OR experience in an SDR/BDR/Lead generation role with an ambition to move into a full 360 closing role
* Previous experience working to and delivering on targets, realistically you will have carried a sales quota of £250,000 minimum in a previous role
* Using the following systems or similar : linkedin Sales Navigator, Lusha, Zint, Salesforce
* Curiosity – we’re after someone with the skills and desire to add new ideas and lead on/help with their implementation
* Drive – we’re after someone who can add serious value through the sales process – for the business, and for the client

Benefits

Our company was built on three core values: ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’

We believe that businesses (and people) do their best work when they’re working collaboratively. That means you’ll be working directly with everyone in the business, right up to the co-founders Jonny and Andrew.

It’s this attitude that saw us voted the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work for, and receive awards for ‘Best at Employee Development’.

And, of course, we offer some great perks the best people...

* Competitive salary and equity options
* Flexible working hours
* 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays)
* Unlimited unpaid holidays
* Professional and personal training budget
* Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
* Dog-friendly office
* Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day and monthly socials
* Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a drink with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

  • Flexible working hours
  • 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays)
  • Unlimited unpaid holidays
  • Professional and personal training budget
  • Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
  • Dog-friendly office
  • Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day and monthly socials
  • Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a drink with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer (Fullstack)
jobs.description:
We’re LandTech. We’re the award-winning tech startup building platforms to bring much-needed innovation to the property industry. We started with LandInsight, which made it easier to find and assess off-market land. Then we launched LandEnhance, bringing tech to the planning sector. And we’ve got plenty more in the pipeline.

We’re the fastest-growing PropTech company in the UK. And PropTech just happens to be one of the fastest-growing sectors in the UK too.

Imagine what that could do for your career progression.

Your Mission

You’ll be working on delivering software, growing and supporting the technical teams, being their advocate, mentor and coach. This will involve providing technical guidance, ensuring best practices, supporting hiring, nurturing and developing the team, and working closely with the business to understand key challenges.

You will be someone who understands what a fast scaling product and company requires, helping the team through this transition as process and culture becomes crucial. You will be someone who understands that cross-company collaboration is paramount to building a great product, and have proven ability to partner closely with the Product, Sales and Customer Success Teams to achieve this.

Right now we have 3 technical teams. Since we're growing fast, we need to line up our next technical lead that can help grow and shape the new team from day one.

You'll work with the CTO and other Tech Leads to establish the new team structure, providing the opportunity to shape and scale your new team from scratch. You will work with our People Team on hiring, training and developing your team, as well as continuing to build an engaging, positive and happy environment as we enter the next phase of our growth.

We have big engineering problems to solve relating to our data (growing and supporting hundreds of datasets), new feature development and expanding our product internationally.


Our Tech and Principles

* Node.js (Vue.js & React), Python, Shell Scripts
* Data stores such as Mongo, Postgres and ElasticSearch
* CI and some CD via CircleCI
* AWS (EB, ECS, Beanstalk, S3) and Kubernetes Cluster (ELK stack, Grafana+Prometheus, Istio)
* A mixture of Lean, DevOps and Agile principles
* Collaborative, test-first, fast-feedback software principles
* A focus on *nix tooling and open source software

Requirements

Essential criteria

* Strong proficiency in engineering
* Strong competency in leading and managing a team, and proving ability to champion a positive and engaged team culture
* Start up experience with scaling teams and implementing solid QA processes
* 3 years+ experience with a Javascript stack
* 10 years+ experience in engineering
* Cloud management experience (AWS, Azure or Google)
* Experience in Postgres, MongoDB.
* Excellent communication skills
* Proven ability to collaborate well with Product teams


Desired criteria

* Node.js/Vue.js/React
* AWS experience – ElasticSearch, EC2, S3.
* SaaS product development experience
* Knowledge of the property sector
* ETL data processes
* Mobile app development, React Native
* Security best practices

Benefits

Our company was built on three core values: ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’

We believe that businesses (and people) do their best work when they’re working collaboratively. That means you’ll be working directly with everyone in the business, right up to the co-founders Jonny and Andrew.

It’s this attitude that saw us voted the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work for, and receive awards for ‘Best at Employee Development’.

And, of course, we offer some great perks the best people...

* Competitive salary and equity options
* Flexible working hours
* 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays)
* Unlimited unpaid holidays
* Professional and personal training budget
* Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
* Dog-friendly office
* Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
* Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a drink with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)
